item.title: Nose Cargo Door Cam System – (Electrical Function)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided accepted maintenance procedures are established and used.

placard.para: Placard per DMP instructions. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If Cam System can be operated manually:
Placard the Nose Cargo Door Control panel: CAM INOP - OPERATE MANUALLY.
Cycle door electrically until "camming" is required.
If MOTOR BRAKE has failed in the released position, manual input will not operate cam system; remove electrical connector to restore manual operation.
After the cam is manually positioned, replace electrical connector.

Complete door operation cycle manually or electrically (AMM 52-31-00). If door will not operate electrically, jumpers may be used on appropriate terminals located on the back side of the main control panel door as follows:

entry.para: Simultaneously jumper terminal TP-1 to terminals TP-6, TP-13 and TP-16

numlitem.para: Prior to departure, verify the door is closed, latched and locked using normal procedures.
If Cam System is jammed and cannot be operated manually:
Placard the Nose Cargo Door Control panel: CAM REMOVED.
Remove and stow Cam Actuator electrical connector.
Remove Cam Actuator (One bolt at each end. See illustration).
Remove Cam Support and Cam (4 bolts in base).
Cycle door electrically to a point where "camming" would normally be required.

Complete door operation cycle manually or electrically (AMM 52-31-00). If door will not operate electrically, jumpers may be used on appropriate terminals located on the back side of the main control panel door as follows:

entry.para: Simultaneously jumper terminal TP-1 to terminals TP-6, TP-13 and TP-16

numlitem.para: Prior to departure, verify the door is closed, latched and locked using normal procedures.
